intro: Lappula caespitosa, commonly known as the tufted lappula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and罂粟. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its flowers are small and yellow, with a distinctive shape that resembles a cup. The plant produces a capsule fruit that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
